g2701.definition: [κατατρέχω] from {{g2596}} and {{g5143}}; to run down, i.e. hasten from a tower

g2702.definition: [καταφέρω] from {{g2596}} and {{g5342}} (including its alternate); to bear down, i.e. (figuratively) overcome (with drowsiness); specially, to cast a vote

g2704.definition: [καταφθείρω] from {{g2596}} and {{g5351}}; to spoil entirely, i.e. (literally) to destroy; or (figuratively) to deprave;

g2706.definition: [καταφρονέω] from {{g2596}} and {{g5426}}; to think against, i.e. disesteem

g2708.definition: [καταχέω] from {{g2596}} and cheo (to pour); to pour down (out)

g2709.definition: [καταχθόνιος] from {{g2596}} and χθών (the ground); subterranean, i.e. infernal (belonging to the world of departed spirits)

g2710.definition: [καταχράομαι] from {{g2596}} and {{g5530}}; to overuse, i.e. misuse

g2711.definition: [καταψύχω] from {{g2596}} and {{g5594}}; to cool down (off), i.e. refresh

g2714.definition: [κατενώπιον] from {{g2596}} and {{g1799}}; directly in front of

g2715.definition: [κατεξουσιάζω] from {{g2596}} and {{g1850}}; to have (wield) full privilege over

g2716.definition: [κατεργάζομαι] from {{g2596}} and {{g2038}}; to work fully, i.e. accomplish; by implication, to finish, fashion

g2718.definition: [κατέρχομαι] from {{g2596}} and {{g2064}} (including its alternate); to come (or go) down (literally or figuratively)

g2719.definition: [κατεσθίω] from {{g2596}} and {{g2068}} (including its alternate); to eat down, i.e. devour (literally or figuratively)

g2720.definition: [κατευθύνω] from {{g2596}} and {{g2116}}; to straighten fully, i.e. (figuratively) direct

g2721.definition: [κατεφίστημι] from {{g2596}} and {{g2186}}; to stand over against, i.e. rush upon (assault)

g2722.definition: [κατέχω] from {{g2596}} and {{g2192}}; to hold down (fast), in various applications (literally or figuratively)

g2723.definition: [κατηγορέω] from {{g2725}}; to be a plaintiff, i.e. to charge with some offence

g2724.definition: [κατηγορία] from {{g2725}}; a complaint ("category"), i.e. criminal charge

g2725.definition: [κατήγορος] from {{g2596}} and {{g58}}; against one in the assembly, i.e. a complainant at law; specially, Satan

g2726.definition: [κατήφεια] from a compound of {{g2596}} and perhaps a derivative of the base of {{g5316}} (meaning downcast in look); demureness, i.e. (by implication) sadness

g2727.definition: [κατηχέω] from {{g2596}} and {{g2279}}; to sound down into the ears, i.e. (by implication) to indoctrinate ("catechize") or (genitive case) to apprise of

g2728.definition: [κατιόω] from {{g2596}} and a derivative of {{g2447}}; to rust down, i.e. corrode

g2730.definition: [κατοικέω] from {{g2596}} and {{g3611}}; to house permanently, i.e. reside (literally or figuratively)

g2731.definition: [κατοίκησις] from {{g2730}}; residence (properly, the act; but by implication, concretely, the mansion)

g2732.definition: [κατοικητήριον] from a derivative of {{g2730}}; a dwelling-place

g2733.definition: [κατοικία] residence (properly, the condition; but by implication, the abode itself)

g2734.definition: [κατοπτρίζομαι] middle voice from a compound of {{g2596}} and a derivative of {{g3700}} (compare {{g2072}}); to mirror oneself, i.e. to see reflected (figuratively)

g2735.definition: [κατόρθωμα] from a compound of {{g2596}} and a derivative of {{g3717}} (compare {{g1357}}); something made fully upright, i.e. (figuratively) rectification (specially, good public administration)

g2738.definition: [καῦμα] from {{g2545}}; properly, a burn (concretely), but used (abstractly) of a glow

g2743.definition: [καυτηριάζω] from a derivative of {{g2545}}; to brand ("cauterize"), i.e. (by implication) to render unsensitive (figuratively)

g2744.definition: [καυχάομαι] from some (obsolete) base akin to that of αὐχέω (to boast) and {{g2172}}; to vaunt (in a good or a bad sense)

g2745.definition: [καύχημα] from {{g2744}}; a boast (properly, the object; by implication, the act) in a good or a bad sense

g2746.definition: [καύχησις] from {{g2744}}; boasting (properly, the act; by implication, the object), in a good or a bad sense

g2747.definition: [Κεγχρεαί] probably from kegchros (millet); Cenchreæ, a port of Corinth

g2748.definition: [Κεδρών] of Hebrew origin ({{h6939}}); Cedron (i.e. Kidron), a brook near Jerusalem

g2749.definition: [κεῖμαι] middle voice of a primary verb; to lie outstretched (literally or figuratively) Compare {{g5087}}.

g2750.definition: [κειρία] of uncertain affinity; a swathe, i.e. winding-sheet

g2753.definition: [κελεύω] from a primary κέλλω (to urge on); "hail"; to incite by word, i.e. order

g2755.definition: [κενόδοξος] from {{g2756}} and {{g1391}}; vainly glorifying, i.e. self-conceited

g2756.definition: [κενός] apparently a primary word; empty (literally or figuratively)

g2757.definition: [κενοφωνία] from a presumed compound of {{g2756}} and {{g5456}}; empty sounding, i.e. fruitless discussion

g2758.definition: [κενόω] from {{g2756}}; to make empty, i.e. (figuratively) to abase, neutralize, falsify

g2759.definition: [κέντρον] from κεντέω (to prick); a point ("centre"), i.e. a sting (figuratively, poison) or goad (figuratively, divine impulse)

g2760.definition: [κεντυρίων] of Latin origin; a centurion, i.e. captain of one hundred soldiers

g2761.definition: [κενῶς] adverb from {{g2756}}; vainly, i.e. to no purpose

g2762.definition: [κεραία] feminine of a presumed derivative of the base of {{g2768}}; something horn-like, i.e. (specially) the apex of a Hebrew letter (figuratively, the least particle)

g2764.definition: [κεραμικός] from {{g2766}}; made of clay, i.e. earthen

g2765.definition: [κεράμιον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{g2766}}; an earthenware vessel, i.e. jar

g2766.definition: [κέραμος] probably from the base of {{g2767}} (through the idea of mixing clay and water); earthenware, i.e. a tile (by analogy, a thin roof or awning)

g2767.definition: [κεράννυμι] prolonged form of a more primary κεράω (which is used in certain tenses); to mingle, i.e. (by implication) to pour out (for drinking) Compare {{g3396}}.

g2768.definition: [κέρας] from a primary κάρ (the hair of the head); a horn (literally or figuratively)

g2769.definition: [κεράτιον] neuter of a presumed derivative of {{g2768}}; something horned, i.e. (specially) the pod of the carob-tree

g2771.definition: [κέρδος] of uncertain affinity; gain (pecuniary or genitive case)

g2772.definition: [κέρμα] from {{g2751}}; a clipping (bit), i.e. (specially) a coin

g2773.definition: [κερματιστής] from a derivative of {{g2772}}; a handler of coins, i.e. money-broker

g2774.definition: [κεφάλαιον] neuter of a derivative of {{g2776}}; a principal thing, i.e. main point; specially, an amount (of money)

g2775.definition: [κεφαλαιόω] from the same as {{g2774}}; (specially) to strike on the head

g2776.definition: [κεφαλή] from the primary κάπτω (in the sense of seizing); the head (as the part most readily taken hold of), literally or figuratively

g2777.definition: [κεφαλίς] from {{g2776}}; properly, a knob, i.e. (by implication) a roll (by extension from the end of a stick on which the manuscript was rolled)

g2778.definition: [κῆνσος] of Latin origin; properly, an enrollment ("census"), i.e. (by implication) a tax

g2780.definition: [κηπουρός] from {{g2779}} and οὖρος (a warden); a garden-keeper, i.e. gardener

g2781.definition: [κηρίον] diminutive from κηός (wax); a cell for honey, i.e. (collectively) the comb

g2782.definition: [κήρυγμα] from {{g2784}}; a proclamation (especially of the gospel; by implication, the gospel itself)

g2783.definition: [κῆρυξ] from {{g2784}}; a herald, i.e. of divine truth (especially of the gospel)

g2784.definition: [κηρύσσω] of uncertain affinity; to herald (as a public crier), especially divine truth (the gospel)

g2785.definition: [κῆτος] probably from the base of {{g5490}}; a huge fish (as gaping for prey)

g2786.definition: [Κηφᾶς] of Chaldee origin (compare {{h3710}}); the Rock; Cephas (i.e. Kepha), a surname of Peter

g2787.definition: [κιβωτός] of uncertain derivation; a box, i.e. the sacred ark and that of Noah

g2789.definition: [κιθαρίζω] from {{g2788}}; to play on a lyre

g2790.definition: [κιθαρῳδός] from {{g2788}} and a derivative of the same as {{g5603}}; a lyre-singer(-player), i.e. harpist

g2791.definition: [Κιλικία] probably of foreign origin; Cilicia, a region of Asia Minor

g2795.definition: [κινέω] from κίω (poetic for εἶμι, to go); to stir (transitively), literally or figuratively

g2797.definition: [Κίς] of Hebrew origin ({{h7027}}); Cis (i.e. Kish), an Israelite

g2798.definition: [κλάδος] from {{g2806}}; a twig or bough (as if broken off)

g2799.definition: [κλαίω] of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. wail aloud (whereas 1145 is rather to cry silently)
